history.content: For the statement of purpose, I talked about how I got interested in the specific topic I wanted to do research in (what classes, previous research in the area, ...) and why specifically Berkeley would be a good fit for me. For the personal history statement, I talked more about my journey into computer science (a bit in HS and more about college activities) and why I wanted to grad school in the first place. I also talked a bit about how teaching gave me some perspective into how comparatively fortunate I was and made me want to spend more time learning. If you have a more unique story, this would be the place to mention it.

From the website:

  • Statement of Purpose - Why are you applying for this program? What will you do during this degree program? What do you want to do after and how will this help you?
  • Personal History Statement - What from your past made you decide to go into this field? And how will your personal history help you succeed in this program and your future goals?

And on the application it says Please describe how your personal background and experiences influenced your decision to pursue a graduate degree. 

I'm a bit confused as to how these really differ. The statement of purpose seems straightforward, but the personal history statement seems to be a subset of the first question in the SOP. Is the Personal history supposed to be generally "Why do you want to go to grad school at berkeley?" (from a non-technical perspective, i.e. culture, fit), or what? The statements after the PHS (asking about barriers to education and underrepresentation) seem to be indicating that they want to read some sort of unorthodox story of how someone came to apply to EECS masters. Is this True? Can anyone who has applied/has done the application share how they approached the separating these 2 questions?
history.subject: Statement of Purpose vs Personal History 5th year masters
